content:
Sure! Here are some ideas for high-protein vegetarian meals:

1. Chickpea and spinach curry: sauté chickpeas, spinach, and onions in a spicy tomato-based sauce (such as tomato paste, garlic, ginger, curry powder, and garam masala).

2. Tofu stir-fry: pan-fry tofu and mixed vegetables in a teriyaki or soy-free sauce (such as sesame oil, low-sodium soy sauce, minced garlic, and minced ginger).

3. Lentil soup: simmer lentils, onions, garlic, carrots, celery, and vegetable broth until tender, and then purée for a smooth consistency.

4. Quinoa salad: toss cooked quinoa with a variety of vegetables, such as crisp lettuce, sweet cherry tomatoes, grated carrots, sliced cucumbers, and diced avocado. Top with a lemon-olive oil dressing.

5. Black bean tacos: sauté black beans with onion and garlic, and then serve in warm tortillas with your choice of toppings, such as crumbled queso fresco, diced red pepper, chopped cilantro, and sliced jalapeño.

6. Spinach and feta stuffed portobella mushrooms: remove the stems from large portobello mushrooms, spoon in a mix of sautéed spinach and crumbled feta cheese, and then bake until tender.

7. Seitan fajitas: slice seitan into strips and sauté with onion and peppers. Serve with warm tortillas or over rice.

Hope these ideas are helpful!
